lead_paragraph: The agency had previously warned that high doses of the drug, fluconazole, might be linked to birth defects. A new study suggests dangers at lower doses.

headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Urges Caution for Infection Drug During Pregnancy
headline.main: F.D.A. Urges Caution on Yeast Infection Drug During Pregnancy

snippet: The agency had previously warned that high doses of the drug, fluconazole, might be linked to birth defects. A new study suggests dangers at lower doses.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration urges doctors to use caution in proscribing oral medication fluconazole to pregnant women for yeast infections, citing possible link to miscarriage.
